intro: Parosela botterii, commonly known as the Botter's parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, coastal environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
